metadata.title: CVE-2015-6765 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability incontent/browser/appcache/appcache_update_job.cc in Google Chrome before47.0.2526.73 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause adenial of service by leveraging the mishandling of AppCache update jobs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6765` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.11.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.11.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.11.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.11.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.11.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.11.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.11.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.11.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
